name: Premier Inn Chesterfield North

reviews.text: Booked a disabled + communicating 2nd room to accommodate myself and parents - found that our rooms were quite some way from reception but close to the emergency exit and the walk was manageable for us. There are other Disabled rooms very close to reception (already occupied during our stay), so if you can't manage the longer distance, mention it when booking!
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly, excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms were clean and comfortable (as always), and the Disabled shower-room was big, well-planned, ideal for our needs.
reviews.title: Very friendly

reviews.text: All the staff were friendly and helpful - check-in fast and efficient and I was very grateful to be helped with the baggage when we arrived!
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The Lockkeeper restaurant staff were also friendly and helpful, must give a special mention to Kyle, who had a great attitude; also the very determined cleaning lady on Monday morning! On our last morning, we found the Disabled toilet in the restaurant unusable due to a broken assistance bar - mentioned this to staff, who immediately checked and confirmed it would be fixed later that day. Very pleased to see such speedy reactions!
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed this trip - thank you!
reviews.title: Better than expected.

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here. The beds are comfortable and the room provides all you need for an overnight stay. Another chair in the room would be nice - if there are two of you one person has to sit on the bed to watch TV. We chose the hotel primarily as a base from which to explore Chatsworth House, and in this respect the location is perfect. The hotel is some way out of town so if you want to dine and drink without driving you would need a taxi - or to eat at the Brewers Fayre which is connected to the hotel. We did the latter and we were all quite happy with our dinner choices. Breakfast is served here and the Breakfst was superb. We found all staff members very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and good value

reviews.text: I stayed in a family room one night in this hote in order to visit the nearby Chatsworth House (which is stunning). While the hotel is basic, at only $60 per night the value was amazing. Breakfast was extra but free for children, as much as you can eat.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money

reviews.text: The room was reasonably clean - close inspection showed some areas of maintenance that need attention, and the bathroom wasnt spotless, but overall clean enough. Overall I was happy given the price.
reviews.title: A welcome room for a very tired lady

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The corridor outside smelt of stale cigarette spoke, but the room itself was smoke free.
reviews.title: Perect location for exploring Derbyshire and the B2Net Stadium
Something in the Water
reviews.text: By the time we got to Premier Inn I was feeling very tired and just wanted to lie down and rest - after doing this for a while I was ready for a good meal. That is exactly what I got and a coupke of drinks and a good sleep I was ready to face the next day travelling home

Close to the M1 and the Chesterfield train station, this hotel has ample free car parking, which is situated at the back of the Lock Keeper pub, which is where you will find the Reception. The hotel is positioned just a couple of miles outside of Chesterfield town centre, and 13 miles away from Chatsworth House. Bolsover castle is a mere 7 miles across the motorway, and there is the entire Peak District on the doorstep. Check out the famous Chesterfield crooked spire on the church of St Mary and All Saints (http://www.chesterfieldparishchurch.org.uk/).
reviews.title: Free car parking is situated at the back of the Lock Keeper pub.

reviews.text: There is an onsite Brewers Fayre (Lock Keeper) restaurant serving the normal pub grub in a family friendly environment. The staff are always helpful and welcoming whenever I visit this hotel, and the pub has a great atmosphere. The rooms are always clean and well maintained, with a small flat screen television in the rooms. As always, there is free tea and coffee in the rooms.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, very friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed on business back in January 2012 for 5 nights. The check inn was quick and easy with the girl on reception asking how my journey had been.
reviews.title: A hidden gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable with tea and coffee facilities. The room is what you would expect of a four star hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The attached restaurant was cheap, and the the food tasted cheap so only ate here on one occasion.
reviews.title: I would stay again for £75.

reviews.text: We were debating a cheap hotel close enough to drive in to the Peak District for several days. The Prem Inn West was also an option, but this was a fair amount cheaper.
reviews.title: Cheap and comfortable option for Peak District

reviews.text: Location is good. Easy to access and quiet, even though it is by a railway line and close to busy dual carriageway. Parking is quite plentiful and right by the building.
reviews.title: Good - but avoid in hot weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room does not offer much else than the bare essentials - but we didn't really need them and we expect this from Prem Inn.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel in hot weather !
Fantastic Staff, "3 out of 10 for the Inn"
reviews.text: That said, TV is large enough and has very good picture. Enough towels, extra pillows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No paper or pen - would have been nice, but not a deal breaker! No phone - even for contact with reception. No alarm clock, although the the tv has an alarm function which is not much good - bring a travel alarm clock.
reviews.title: Anothergood night sleep

aka: Premier Inn Chesterfield North Hotel Chesterfield
